description: System-generated unique identifier for the currency record used as the primary key for joins and references.
Business key for the currency, likely the ISO 4217 code used to tag monetary amounts; confirm with SME.
Human-readable currency name for display, selection lists, and reporting.
Indicator showing whether this currency is currently enabled for use in pricing, invoicing, or transactions.
Timestamp when this currency was most recently referenced in a transaction or record.
Free-text administrative notes about the currency or its usage constraints.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this currency record.
Character used to separate the fractional part when formatting currency amounts per locale.
Character used to group thousands when formatting currency amounts per locale.
Symbol used to denote negative currency amounts in formatted output.
Number of digits per group for thousands grouping in formatted currency values; confirm with SME.
Number of fractional digits for this currency’s minor units when formatting amounts.
Formatting pattern for negative monetary values, such as minus sign or parentheses; confirm with SME.
Symbol representing the currency in displays and reports.
Locale or region code used to drive currency formatting conventions.
Audit timestamp of the last user-initiated modification to this record; likely redundant with the general modification timestamp—confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user who originally created this currency record.
Timestamp when this currency record was created by a user.
Identifier of the user who last modified this currency record.
Timestamp when this currency record was last modified by a user.
